summary: This mod adds two new Swords to the game.
descriptionHtml:
Featured Video(s)

[youtube]wu4ZPN88vhM[/youtube] [youtube]dp7BXv9BzDM[/youtube]
[youtube]B-2tJ2A1UEw[/youtube]




Nicos Raven Swords v.1.2
__________________________


Reason for this mod:
_____________________

One of the community at Skyrim Nexus PMed me with a picture of a sword.

I no longer do requests of any kind but I really liked the shape of the blades so decided to make them the way I wanted them for my own game.

This is the result.



What does this mod do?:
________________________

This mod adds 3 custom (hi-res) swords to Azura's Shrine.

They can be found crossed on a crate to the left, and down from the main altar.

They are also craftable using the Ebony Smithing perk, and can be upgraded.

They are slightly stronger, and lighter than the Ebony Sword.



Installation Instructions:
___________________________

Unpack the 7zip archive to a known location (like your desktop).

Open the folder, and find the folder within marked 'Data'

Drag, and drop or right click 'copy to' your Skyrim folder (normally located at C:SteamSteamappsCommonSkyrim

When prompted by windows if you;d like to overwrite files with the same name answer "Yes to All".

Start up Skyrim, and under 'Data' be sure there is a checkmark by the mod's name in your list.

Play, and enjoy :)


Uninstall:
___________

Run a windows search for 'Nicos Raven Swords'

Delete everything it finds.


Version History:
_________________

1.0 initial release

1.1 added a Greatsword of the same design

1.2 added missing .nif (Oops)
Credits:
_________

Raven Armory (they make an actual sword that looks a lot like this) for the original design that this model is based on.

oHeXo for sending me a picture of this blade.


Permissions:
_____________


None granted without contacting me personally first, and gaining my blessing.


Author's Note:
_______________


I had some complaints/ reviews that some of my work was 'low res'. I used to worry about polygon count, and texture size because I used to get complaints about my models lagging people's game for Oblivion.

Seems the systems now for Skyrim can handle it so stepped it up a notch.

Texture is 2048x2048, model polygon count is 4682.

I am happy with it, and hope you will be too.

This mod is dedicated to my lovely wife, and her battle against cancer.
author: Nicoroshi
